intro: Trichoscypha tessmannii, commonly known as the African sandflea tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
